metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000132 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mercurial version 4.5 and earlier contains a Incorrect Access Control(CWE-285) vulnerability in Protocol server that can result in Unauthorizeddata access. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 4.5.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 4.5.2-0ubuntu2
mercurial-common - 4.5.2-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.2-0ubuntu2').
